abstract: Studies have shown that, despite investors’ willingness to pay higher fees and expenses for actively managed mutual funds, these funds rarely beat the market over the long term.
snippet: Studies have shown that, despite investors’ willingness to pay higher fees and expenses for actively managed mutual funds, these funds rarely beat the market over the long term.
lead_paragraph: THE desire to beat the stock market is as American as baseball, apple pie and Warren Buffett. This urge to achieve better-than-average investment returns may have been subdued by the financial crisis, but it’s still the core of many strategies.

headline.main: That Rush to Beat the Market
headline.print_headline: That Rush to Beat the Market
